openingRemarks: Use quadratic equation formula to solve these quadratic equations. NB: Quadratic equations are equations of the form \(ax^2 + bx + c = 0\) where \(a \ne 0\)

questions.question: \(10x^{2}+11 x+3=0\)
questions.answer:
Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 10, b = 11 and c = 3 \[ \begin{align*} 10x^{2}+11 x+3&=0 \\ x_1,x_2&=\dfrac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^{2}-4 a c}}{2 a} \\ &=\dfrac{-11 \pm \sqrt{11^{2}-4(10)(3)}}{2(10)} \\ &=-11 \pm \dfrac{\sqrt{121-120}}{20} \\ &=\dfrac{-11 \pm \sqrt{1}}{20} \\ &=\dfrac{-11 \pm 1}{20} \\ x_1&=\dfrac{-11+1}{20} \\ &=\dfrac{-10}{20}\\ &=-\dfrac{1}{2} \\ \\ x_2&=\dfrac{-11-1}{20} \\ &=\dfrac{-12}{20} \\ &=-\dfrac{3}{5} \\ \end{align*} \]

Check LHS = 0
Evaluate \( 10 x^{2}+11 x+3 \) if \(x=-\dfrac{1}{2} \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=10\left(-\dfrac{1}{2}\right)^{2}+11\left(-\dfrac{1}{2}\right)+3 \\ &=10\left(\dfrac{1}{4}\right)-\dfrac{11}{2}+3 \\ &=\dfrac{5}{2}-\dfrac{5}{2} \\ &=0 \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 10 x^{2}+11 x+3 \) if \(x=-\dfrac{3}{5} \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=10\left(-\dfrac{3}{5}\right)^{2}+11\left(-\dfrac{3}{5}\right)+3 \\ &=10\left(\dfrac{9}{25}\right)-\dfrac{33}{5}+3 \\ &=\dfrac{18}{5}-\dfrac{18}{5} \\ &=0 \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(10x^{2}-31 x+15=0\)
questions.answer:
Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 10, b = -31 and c = 15 \[ \begin{align*} 10x^{2}-31 x+15&=0 \\ x_1,x_2&=\dfrac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^{2}-4 a c}}{2 a} \\ &=\dfrac{-(-31) \pm \sqrt{(-31)^{2}-4(10)(15)}}{2(10)} \\ &=\dfrac{31 \pm \sqrt{961-600}}{20} \\ &=\dfrac{31 \pm \sqrt{361}}{20} \\ &=\dfrac{31 \pm 19}{20} \\ x_1&=\dfrac{31+19}{20} \\ &=\dfrac{50}{20}\\ &=\dfrac{5}{2} \\ \\ x_2&=\dfrac{31-19}{20} \\ &=\dfrac{12}{20}\\ &=\dfrac{3}{5} \\ \end{align*} \]

Check LHS = 0
Evaluate \( 10 x^{2}-31 x+15 \) if \(x=\dfrac{5}{2} \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=10\left(\dfrac{5}{2}\right)^{2}-31\left(\dfrac{5}{2}\right)+15 \\ &=10\left(\dfrac{25}{4}\right)-\dfrac{155}{2}+15 \\ &=\dfrac{125}{2}-\dfrac{125}{2}\\ &=0 \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 10 x^{2}-31 x+15 \) if \(x=\dfrac{3}{5} \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=10\left(\dfrac{3}{5}\right)^{2}-31\left(\dfrac{3}{5}\right)+15 \\ &=10\left(\dfrac{9}{25}\right)-\dfrac{93}{5}+15 \\ &=\dfrac{18}{5} - \dfrac{18}{5}\\ &=0 \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(8x^{2}-6x+1=0\)
questions.answer:
Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 8, b = -6 and c = 1 \[ \begin{align*} 8x^{2}-6x+1&=0 \\ x_1,x_2&=\dfrac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^{2}-4 a c}}{2 a} \\ &=\dfrac{-(-6) \pm \sqrt{(-6)^{2}-4(8)(1)}}{2(8)} \\ &=\dfrac{6 \pm \sqrt{36-32}}{16} \\ &=\dfrac{6 \pm \sqrt{4}}{16} \\ &=\dfrac{6 \pm 2}{16} \\ x_1&=\dfrac{6+2}{16} \\ &=\dfrac{8}{16} \\ &=\dfrac{1}{2} \\ \\ x_2&=\dfrac{6 - 2}{16} \\ &=\dfrac{4}{16} \\ &=\dfrac{1}{4} \\ \end{align*} \]

Check LHS = 0
Evaluate \( 8x^{2}-6x+1 \) if \(x=\dfrac{1}{2} \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=8\left(\dfrac{1}{2}\right)^{2}-6\left(\dfrac{1}{2}\right)+1 \\ &=8\left(\dfrac{1}{4}\right)-3+1 \\ &=2-2 \\ &=0 \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 8x^{2}-6x+1 \) if \(x=\dfrac{1}{4} \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=8\left(\dfrac{1}{4}\right)^{2}-6\left(\dfrac{1}{4}\right)+1 \\ &=8\left(\dfrac{1}{16}\right)-\dfrac{3}{2}+1 \\ &=\dfrac{1}{2}-\dfrac{1}{2} \\ &=0 \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(8x^{2}-14x+3=0\)
questions.answer:
Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 8, b = -14 and c = 3 \[ \begin{align*} 8x^{2}-14x+3&=0 \\ x_1,x_2&=\dfrac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^{2}-4 a c}}{2 a} \\ &=\dfrac{-(-14) \pm \sqrt{(-14)^{2}-4(8)(3)}}{2(8)} \\ &=14 \pm \dfrac{\sqrt{196-96}}{16} \\ &=\dfrac{14 \pm \sqrt{100}}{16} \\ &=\dfrac{14 \pm 10}{16} \\ x_1&=\dfrac{14+10}{16} \\ &=\dfrac{24}{16} \\ &=\dfrac{3}{2} \\ \\ x_2&=\dfrac{14-10}{16} \\ &=\dfrac{4}{16} \\ &=\dfrac{1}{4} \\ \end{align*} \]

Check LHS = 0
Evaluate \( 8x^{2}-14x+3 \) if \(x=\dfrac{3}{2} \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=8\left(\dfrac{3}{2}\right)^{2}-14\left(\dfrac{3}{2}\right)+3 \\ &=8\left(\dfrac{9}{4}\right)-21+3 \\ &=18-18 \\ &=0 \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 8x^{2}-14x+3 \) if \(x=\dfrac{1}{4} \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=8\left(\dfrac{1}{4}\right)^{2}-14\left(\dfrac{1}{4}\right)+3 \\ &=8\left(\dfrac{1}{16}\right)-\dfrac{7}{2}+3 \\ &=\dfrac{1}{2}-\dfrac{1}{2} \\ &=0 \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(5 x^{2}+8 x=-3\)
questions.answer:
\[ \begin{align*} 5 x^{2}+8 x&=-3 \\ 5 x^{2}+8 x+3&=0 \\ \end{align*} \]

Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 5, b = 8 and c = 3 \[ \begin{align*} 5 x^{2}+8 x+3&=0 \\ x_1,x_2&=\dfrac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^{2}-4 a c}}{2 a} \\ &=\dfrac{-8 \pm \sqrt{8^{2}-4(5)(3)}}{2(5)} \\ &=\dfrac{-8 \pm \sqrt{64-60}}{10} \\ &=\dfrac{-8 \pm \sqrt{4}}{10} \\ &=\dfrac{-8 \pm 2}{10} \\ x_1&=\dfrac{-8+2}{10} \\ &=\dfrac{-6}{10} \\ &=-\dfrac{3}{5} \\ \\ x_2&=\dfrac{-8-2}{10} \\ &=\dfrac{-10}{10} \\ &=-1 \\ \end{align*} \]

Check LHS = -3
Evaluate \( 5 x^{2}+8 x \) if \(x=-\dfrac{3}{5}\)
\[ \begin{align*} &=5\left(-\dfrac{3}{5}\right)^{2}+8\left(-\dfrac{3}{5}\right) \\ &=5\left(\dfrac{9}{25}\right)-\dfrac{24}{5} \\ &=\dfrac{9}{5}-\dfrac{24}{5} \\ &=-3 \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 5 x^{2}+8 x \) if \(x=-1\)
\[ \begin{align*} &=5(-1)^{2}+8(-1) \\ &=5(1)-8 \\ &=5-8 \\ &=-3 \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(5 x^{2}=27 x+18\)
questions.answer:
\[ \begin{align*} 5 x^{2}&=27 x+18 \\ 5 x^{2}-27 x-18&=0 \\ \end{align*} \]

Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 5, b = -27 and c = -18 \[ \begin{align*} 5 x^{2}-27 x-18&=0 \\ &=\dfrac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^{2}-4 a c}}{2 a} \\ &=\dfrac{-(-27) \pm \sqrt{(-27)^{2}-4(5)(-18)}}{2(5)} \\ &=\dfrac{27 \pm \sqrt{729+360}}{10} \\ &=\dfrac{27 \pm \sqrt{1089}}{10} \\ &=\dfrac{27 \pm 33}{10} \\ x_1&=\dfrac{27+33}{10} \\ &=\dfrac{60}{10} \\ &=6 \\ \\ x_2&=\dfrac{27-33}{10} \\ &=\dfrac{-6}{10} \\ &=-\dfrac{3}{5}\\ \end{align*} \]

Check LHS = RHS
Evaluate \( 5 x^{2}\) if \(x=6 \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=5(6)^{2} \\ &=5(36)\\ &=180 \\ \\ \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 27x+18\) if \(x=6\)
\[ \begin{align*} &=27(6)+18 \\ &=162+18 \\ &=180 \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 5 x^{2}\) if \( x=-\dfrac{3}{5} \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=5\left(-\dfrac{3}{5}\right)^{2} \\ &=5\left(\dfrac{9}{25}\right) \\ &=\dfrac{9}{5} \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 27x+18\) if \(x=-\dfrac{3}{5} \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=27\left(-\dfrac{3}{5}\right)+18 \\ &=-\dfrac{81}{5}+18\\ &=\dfrac{9}{5}\\ \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(10 x^{2}=3x+1\)
questions.answer:
\[ \begin{align*} 10 x^{2}&=3x+1 \\ 10 x^{2}-3x-1&=0 \\ \end{align*} \]

Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 10, b = -3 and c = -1\[ \begin{align*} 10 x^{2}-3x-1&=0 \\ x_1,x_2&=\dfrac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^{2}-4 a c}}{2 a} \\ &=\dfrac{-(-3) \pm \sqrt{(-3)^{2}-4(10)(-1)}}{2(10)} \\ &=\dfrac{3 \pm \sqrt{9+40}}{20} \\ &=\dfrac{3 \pm \sqrt{49}}{20} \\ &=\dfrac{3 \pm 7}{20}\\ \\ x_1&=\dfrac{3+7}{20} \\ &=\frac{10}{20} \\ &=\frac{1}{2} \\ \\ x_2&=\dfrac{3-7}{20} \\ &=\dfrac{-4}{20}\\ &=-\dfrac{1}{5}\\ \end{align*} \]

Check LHS = RHS
Evaluate \( 10 x^{2}\) if \(x=-\dfrac{1}{5} \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=10\left(-\dfrac{1}{5}\right)^{2} \\ &=10\left(\dfrac{1}{25}\right)\\ &=\dfrac{2}{5} \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 3x+1\) if \(x=-\dfrac{1}{5} \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=3\left(-\dfrac{1}{5}\right)+1 \\ &=-\dfrac{3}{5}+1 \\ &=\dfrac{2}{5} \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 10 x^{2}\) if \( x=\dfrac{1}{2} \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=10\left(\dfrac{1}{2}\right)^{2}\\ &=10\left(\dfrac{1}{4}\right) \\ &=\dfrac{5}{2} \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 3x+1\) if \(x=\dfrac{1}{2} \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=3\left(\dfrac{1}{2}\right)+1 \\ &=\dfrac{3}{2}+1\\ &=\dfrac{5}{2}\\ \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(10 x^{2}=25 x+15\)
questions.answer:
\[ \begin{align*} 10 x^{2}&=25 x+15 \\ 10 x^{2}-25 x-15&=0 \\ \end{align*} \]

Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 10, b = -25 and c = -15 \[ \begin{align*} 10 x^{2}-25 x-15&=0 \\ x_1,x_2&=\dfrac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^{2}-4 a c}}{2 a} \\ &=-\dfrac{(-25) \pm \sqrt{(-25)^{2}-4(10)(-15)}}{2(10)} \\ &=\dfrac{25 \pm \sqrt{625+600}}{20} \\ &=\dfrac{25 \pm \sqrt{1225}}{20} \\ &=\dfrac{25 \pm 35}{20} \\ x_1&=\dfrac{25+35}{20} \\ &=\dfrac{60}{20}\\ &=3 \\ \\ x_2&=\dfrac{25-35}{20} \\ &=\dfrac{-10}{20}\\ &=-\dfrac{1}{2}\\ \end{align*} \]

Check LHS = RHS
Evaluate \( 10 x^{2}\) if \(x=-\dfrac{1}{2}\)
\[ \begin{align*} &=10\left(-\dfrac{1}{2}\right)^{2} \\ &=10\left(\dfrac{1}{4}\right) \\ &=\dfrac{5}{2} \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 2x+15\) if \(x=-\dfrac{1}{2} \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=25\left(-\dfrac{1}{2}\right)+15 \\ &=-\dfrac{25}{2}+15 \\ &=\dfrac{5}{2} \\ \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 10 x^{2}\) if \( x=3\)
\[ \begin{align*} &=10(3)^{2} \\ &=10(9) \\ & =90\\ \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 25x+15\) if \(x=3 \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=25(3)+15 \\ &=75+15 \\ &=90 \\ \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(2 x^{2}=9(x+2)\)
questions.answer:
\[ \begin{align*} 2 x^{2}&=9(x+2) \\ 2 x^{2}&=9 x+18 \\ 2 x^{2}-9 x-18&=0 \\ \end{align*} \]

Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a=2, d b=-9, c=-18 \[ \begin{align*} 2 x^{2}-9 x-18&=0 \\ x_1,x_2&=-b \pm \dfrac{\sqrt{b^{2}-4 a c}}{2 a} \\ &=\dfrac{-(-9) \pm \sqrt{(-9)^{2}-4(2)(-18)}}{2(2)} \\ &=\dfrac{9 \pm \sqrt{81+144}}{4} \\ &=\dfrac{9 \pm \sqrt{225}}{4} \\ &=\dfrac{9 \pm 15}{4} \\\\ x_1&=\dfrac{9+15}{4} \\ &=\dfrac{24}{4}\\ &=6 \\ \\ x_2&=\dfrac{9-15}{4} \\ &=\dfrac{-6}{4}\\ &=-\dfrac{3}{2}\\ \end{align*} \]

Check LHS = RHS
Evaluate \( 2x^{2}\) if \(x=6\)
\[ \begin{align*} &=2(6)^{2} \\ &=2(36)\\ &=72 \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 9(x+2)\) if \(x=6 \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=9(6+2) \\ &=9(8)\\ &=72 \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 2x^{2}\) if \(x=-\dfrac{3}{2}\)
\[ \begin{align*} &=2\left(-\dfrac{3}{2}\right)^{2} \\ &=2\left(\dfrac{9}{4}\right)\\ &=\dfrac{9}{2}\\ \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 9(x+2)\) if \( x=-\dfrac{3}{2} \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=9\left(-\dfrac{3}{2}+2\right) \\ &=-\dfrac{27}{2}+18 \\ &=\dfrac{9}{2}\\ \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(x^{2}+4 x-2=0\)
questions.answer: Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 1, b = 4 and c = -2 \[ \begin{align*} x^{2}+4 x-2&=0 \\ x=\dfrac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^{2}-4ac}}{2a} \\ x=\dfrac{-4 \pm \sqrt{4^{2}-4(1)(-2)}}{2(1)} \\ x=\dfrac{-4 \pm \sqrt{16+8}}{2} \\ x=\dfrac{-4 \pm \sqrt{24}}{2} \\ x=\dfrac{-4+4.90}{2} \\ x=0.50 \\ \\ x=\dfrac{-4-4.90}{2} \\ x=-4.50 \\ \end{align*} \]
